solution_line_template: In the first half of the year, the company constructed {fraction_built_first_half}*{contracted_houses} = <<{fraction_built_first_half}*{contracted_houses}={units_built_first_half}>>{units_built_first_half} units.

The number of units remaining to be built after the company built {units_built_first_half} units in the first half of the year is {contracted_houses}-{units_built_first_half} = <<{contracted_houses}-{units_built_first_half}={units_remaining_after_first_half}>>{units_remaining_after_first_half}

By October, the company built an additional {additional_units_by_october} units, thus remaining with {units_remaining_after_first_half}-{additional_units_by_october} = <<{units_remaining_after_first_half}-{additional_units_by_october}={final_units_remaining}>>{final_units_remaining} units to be built.
